messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Debra Rossing"
<debra.rossing@...> wrote:
>
> She's right - it's about unschooling and how to move in the direction of
> unschooling and respectful parenting, REGARDLESS of what an individual's
> belief system is or is not.

Thankyou Deb, it really is regardless of different beliefs. We are a
Vaisnava family, although I was raised Catholic, and the truth is the
basic principles are the same, humility, tolerance, love, and the
other qualities you mention below.

> because we're different families with different belief systems BUT the
> basic principles are the same - love, respect, trust, freedom (and
> aren't they the bottom line principles of Christianity anyhow?)
>
> Deb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: Wow!  All thos CAPS hurt my head too and its too early for that!  Think JOY! There are christian unschooling lists and if you want them feel free to email me
messages.messageBody:
Wow! All thos CAPS hurt my head too and its too early for that! Think JOY!

There are christian unschooling lists and if you want them feel free to
email me off list. This is a list for everyone and unschooling is about
respect.. for everyone and their beliefs.

I love this list and enjoy all that I read and learn about every day. Our
journey into unschooling is just beginning and its been made easier and more
real by this list.

Erica

messages.subject: Re:CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: Well, I believe in Jesus with my whole heart and soul. However, this is a group about unschooling and not a strictly christian one. I believe there are groups
messages.messageBody:
Well, I believe in Jesus with my whole heart and soul. However, this is a group about unschooling and not a strictly christian one. I believe there are groups you can find that ARE christian groups.
In no way am I denying Jesus, and I too feel it is my duty to fulfill the great commission. HOWEVER, you can't do that by shouting at people all the time. Sometimes just being known as a Christian can be the greatest light you can shine.
The bible says you are not to behave so that people will see you as a fool. I am NOT saying you are a fool, but to trying to cram Jesus down the throat of those who are not here to hear that, is unfruitful and unwanted.
Thats all the Christianity you will hear from me unless someone wants to talk to me off list about it!
Blessings-
Mindy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: I think you should slow down, take a breath and read what is being stated to you. No one has stated what you are or are not to BELIEVE in. What has been stated
messages.messageBody:
I think you should slow down, take a breath and read what is being stated to you. No one has stated what you are or are not to BELIEVE in. What has been stated is that some things that have been posted are in fact against the posting guidelines of the group. This is not communism, this is a small community of people tied together by email.

To reinstate what Ren already let you know, you need to read up on the subject of Communism before throwing the term around, it doesn't make you seem smarter or better than anyone else here to use a big word improperly.
----- Original Message -----
From: kbcdlovejo@...
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, March 27, 2007 10:05 AM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: CHRISTIAN VALUES!



-----Original Message-----
From: beautifulsassyprincess@...

I don't think i am out of line,i believe what i believe if your
going to tell me
not to then thats communism.

-=-=-=-=-=

This is a privately owned list. Owned by me and Ren. Ren and I and our
moderators, Deb and Rue, have the right to tell anyone anything on our
list. That's not communism (we *own* the list).

The list is about unschooling---how to incorporate it into your life.
Do you want to unschool? Why? Do you understand what it's about? Do you
want to?

We can help.

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org

__________________________________________________________

from AOL at AOL.com.

messages.subject: Re: CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: Most of our words are simply falling on deaf ears folks. The person in question has now written me offlist to inform me that it s a free country and she can
messages.messageBody:
Most of our words are simply falling on deaf ears folks. The person in
question has now written me offlist to inform me that it's a free
country and she can post whatever she wants at my list and email me
whatever she wants about Jesus because it's her right.

I don't think all the collective energy in trying to help is doing
much good unfortunately. There have been some really fabulous posts
throughout this discussion though.:)

I think I'm going to leave the twilight zone now and go rub Trevor's
back. He's getting the flu and needs his Mum.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: beautifulsassyprincess@yahoo.com IF ANYONE IS IN THIS THIS GROUP AND BELIEVES IN jesus,MS REN ALLEN HAS INFORMED ME THATS NOT WHAT THIS GROUP IS
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: beautifulsassyprincess@...

IF ANYONE IS IN THIS THIS GROUP AND BELIEVES IN jesus,MS REN ALLEN
HAS
INFORMED ME THATS NOT WHAT THIS GROUP IS ABOUT.


-=-=-=-=-


I know there are many Christians on this list. It doesn't matter. This
is a secular list to discuss unschooling. Religion doesn't enter into
it.


Unschooling and Mindful Parenting transcend religion. It's about how
you treat your children---no matter what your religion or lack of.



~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org


________________________________________________________________________

from AOL at AOL.com.

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re:CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you,so much Deb!Your right and i do appreciate your words very much Debra Rossing  wrote:          She s right - it s about
messages.messageBody:
Thank you,so much Deb!Your right and i do appreciate your words very much

Debra Rossing <debra.rossing@...> wrote: She's right - it's about unschooling and how to move in the direction of
unschooling and respectful parenting, REGARDLESS of what an individual's
belief system is or is not. I *am* a Christian and don't see a problem
combining unschooling and my belief in Jesus. My responses to situations
posed are rooted in my belief system, as is everything I do every day
(or at least I try to). There's nothing yet that I've found that creates
a dichotomy between belief in Jesus and unschooling. There are groups
*specific to* Christian unschoolers - that's not this one. This is
unschooling Basics - belief system is irrelevant to someone who is
trying to get a handle on what unschooling is and how it works and what
it looks like day to day. My house will look different than Ren's
because we're different families with different belief systems BUT the
basic principles are the same - love, respect, trust, freedom (and
aren't they the bottom line principles of Christianity anyhow?)

Deb

messages.subject: Re: CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: ~~I don t think i am out of line,i believe what i believe if your going to tell me not to then thats communism.~~ Did I just drop into the twilight zone????
messages.messageBody:
~~I don't think i am out of line,i believe what i believe if your
going to tell me not to then thats communism.~~


Did I just drop into the twilight zone????

First of all, if you're posting against list guidelines that has
nothing to do with telling you what to believe. It's called running a
list in the way we believe is best and if you don't like it, there are
other lists. Our guidelines exist to help everyone get the most out of
the UNschooling discussion.

Secondly, communism isn't telling people what to believe....it's a
philosophy though. You can read more about it here:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communism

No, I'm not a communist, but I do enjoy reading about points of view
that are different from my own.:)

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: ~~IMO relating unschooling to Christian values or not would really limit the group.~~ Exactly. We re an inclusive group, which means that their are people of
messages.messageBody:
~~IMO relating unschooling to Christian values or not would really
limit the group.~~

Exactly. We're an inclusive group, which means that their are people
of many different faiths (or no faith) present here and I don't want
anyone to feel preached at about ANYTHING religious. We're all here to
discuss unschooling and gentle parenting, not religious beliefs.

If your religion causes you to hit, spank or shame children, it might
be time to rethink the whole issue.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you,very much Anita! The Jeffrees  wrote:          What? IMO relating unschooling to Christian values or not would really
messages.messageBody:
Thank you,very much Anita!

The Jeffrees <thejeffrees@...> wrote: What?

IMO relating unschooling to Christian values or not would really limit the group.

I think it's important to maintain that distinction. I'm sure there are a zillion specific Christian Unschooling lists out there.

Anita
-xxx-

messages.subject: Re:CHRISTIAN VALUES!
messages.msgSnippet: She s right - it s about unschooling and how to move in the direction of unschooling and respectful parenting, REGARDLESS of what an individual s belief system
messages.messageBody:
She's right - it's about unschooling and how to move in the direction of
unschooling and respectful parenting, REGARDLESS of what an individual's
belief system is or is not. I *am* a Christian and don't see a problem
combining unschooling and my belief in Jesus. My responses to situations
posed are rooted in my belief system, as is everything I do every day
(or at least I try to). There's nothing yet that I've found that creates
a dichotomy between belief in Jesus and unschooling. There are groups
*specific to* Christian unschoolers - that's not this one. This is
unschooling Basics - belief system is irrelevant to someone who is
trying to get a handle on what unschooling is and how it works and what
it looks like day to day. My house will look different than Ren's
because we're different families with different belief systems BUT the
basic principles are the same - love, respect, trust, freedom (and
aren't they the bottom line principles of Christianity anyhow?)

Deb
